page.title: 11THE WETLANDS AND DRAINAGE
page.content: Around{Moss and Fenwick}in 1850's there was a lot of flooding. The ground is flat and the soil is clay which means the water can not drain away. The land is only 5 feet above sea level. It was no use for farming. Then they started a{drainage system which continues to the present day. They dug the ground up and put pipes in. Also the{River Went}used to flood a lot in winter so they got rid of the old course and changed the embankments so they were a lot higher so the water would not flood. One area is still {wet land}but this is going to be drained in the next few years.
